News Newsroom menu block two Stories Events Newsroom menu block three Communication Resources Press Kit Contact Contact Join Donate search Breadcrumb AmeriCorps Opportunity Youth Evaluation Bundling Project Back In 2014, the Office of Research and Evaluation (ORE) and AmeriCorps State and National (ASN) began an evaluation of grantee programs that engage opportunity youth (OY) as AmeriCorps members. The evaluation bundled 19 ASN programs into a single, collaboratively designed impact evaluation. The study assessed whether OY who participated in AmeriCorps showed greater improvements in education, employment, and civic engagement outcomes than comparison youth. While ASN OY were not more likely to show improvements on key outcomes than comparison youth, ASN OY showed improvements from pre-test to follow-up on a number of key outcomes, including high school completion and current employment, for example. Full report Full Report FINAL Bundling Final Report 2018.01.16_to CNCS_508.pdf Further information Program/Intervention AmeriCorps Membership Implementing Organization CNCS (on behalf of 19 programs/sites) AmeriCorps Program(s) AmeriCorps State and National Age(s) Studied 6-12 (Childhood) 13-17 (Adolescent) 18-25 (Young adult) Outcome Category Employment Post-secondary educational support Study Type(s) Impact Study Design(s) Quasi-Experimental (QED) Level of Evidence Strong Researcher/Evaluator JBS International, Inc. Published Year 2018 Report Citation Frazier, R., Pratt, D., Cardazone, G., Hartig, M., Liang, J., Georges, A. (2018). Final Report for AmeriCorps Opportunity Youth Evaluation Bundling.
